description: Redevelopment to provide part two, part single storey family dwelling house with internal courtyard; (Following the demolition of existing two storey single family dwelling house including the felling of existing tree to the front garden)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Existing ground floor plan: Drawing no. ex_02 dated 16/10/2016; Existing front & rear elevations: Drawing no. ex_03 dated 16/10/2016; Existing street elevation: Drawing no. ex_04 dated 16/10/2016; Proposed ground floor plan: Drawing no. pl_10 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Proposed first floor plan: Drawing no. pl_11 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Site & roof plan (block plan): Drawing no. pl_12 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Front, rear & street elevations: Drawing no. pl_13 rev B dated 10/08/2017; North & south (side) elevations: Drawing no. pl_14 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Sections a-a & b-b: Drawing no. pl_15 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Sections c-c & d-d: Drawing no. pl_16 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Sections e-e & f-f: Drawing no. pl_17 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Rear isometric view: Drawing no. pl_18 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Front isometric view: Drawing no. pl_19 rev B dated 10/08/2017; Aboricultural Impact Assessment: Drawing no. PL_10 dated 03/2017; Tree constraints plan: Drawing no. Arbtech TCP 01 dated 03/2017.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013).

| The roof lights hereby approved shall not protrude more than 150 millimetres beyond the plane of the original roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the original roof.

REASON: To ensure that the development harmonises with the surroundings and the host building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2 (f) of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policy 7.4 of the London Plan (2016). | A detailed landscape plan shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site. The landscape plan shall include details of a new tree to be planted in the rear amenity space on site capable of achieving a similar maturity and size to the Robina tree to be removed as part of the development.

REASON: To ensure that the development does not result in any net loss of tress in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.10 of the London Plan (2016). | No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with the development hereby approved until an Arboricultural report comprising an Arboricultural impact assessment, Arboricultural method statement and tree protection plan is submitted to and has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works. Details shall include the following:

o	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837:2012, with tree works proposals. All trees must be plotted on a site plan, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o	A plan detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal.
o	Soil assessments/survey
o	Timing and phasing of works
o	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o	Site specific construction specifications
o	Access arrangements and car parking
o	Level changes
o	Landscaping proposals

o	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o	Soil remediation plans.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural report shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

REASON: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.10 of the London Plan (2016). | A detailed construction method statement (including the construction of the basement) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; details of protection measures to ensure neighbouring trees will protected from damage as a result of the development; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, delivery times, dust suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.

REASON: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13,  7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Cycle storage for a minimum of two (2) bicycles shall be provided onsite in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure satisfactory amenity is achieved for future residents of the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and polices 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorized by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
